author: Albert Einstein
quote: If at first, the idea is not absurd, then there is no hope for it.

author: Rollo May
quote: If you do not express your own original ideas, if you do not listen to your own being, you will have betrayed yourself.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: An idea that is not dangerous is unworthy of being called an idea at all.

author: John Steinbeck
quote: Ideas are like rabbits. You get a couple and learn how to handle them, and pretty soon you have a dozen.

author: Linus Pauling
quote: The way to get good ideas is to get lots of ideas and throw the bad ones away.

author: Victor Hugo
quote: There is one thing stronger than all the armies in the world, and that is an idea whose time has come.

author: Alfred North Whitehead
quote: Ideas won't keep. Something must be done about them.

author: Ovid
quote: A new idea is delicate. It can be killed by a sneer or a yawn; it can be stabbed to death by a quip and worried to death by a frown on the right man's brow.

author: Napoleon Hill
quote: All achievements, all earned riches, have their beginning in an idea.

author: Lee Iacocca
quote: You can have brilliant ideas, but if you can't get them across, your ideas won't get you anywhere.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
quote: No grand idea was ever born in a conference, but a lot of foolish ideas have died there.

author: Thomas Edison
quote: Nearly every man who develops an idea works it up to the point where it looks impossible, and then he gets discouraged. That's not the place to become discouraged.

author: Charles Peguy
quote: It is the essence of genius to make use of the simplest ideas.

author: Emile Chartier
quote: Nothing is more dangerous than an idea when it is the only one you have.

author: Samuel Goldwyn
quote: I had a monumental idea this morning, but I didn't like it.

author: Charles Dickens
quote: An idea, like a ghost, must be spoken to a little before it will explain itself.

author: Carl Jung
quote: Everyone is in love with their own ideas.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Why is it I always get my best ideas while shaving?

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
quote: One's mind, once stretched by a new idea, never regains its original dimensions.

author: Henry Ford
quote: The air is full of ideas. They are knocking you in the head all the time. You only have to know what you want, then forget it, and go about your business. Suddenly, the idea will come through. It was there all the time.

author: Earl Nightengale
quote: Everything begins with an idea.

author: Harvey Firestone
quote: Capital isn't that important in business. Experience isn't that important. You can get both of these things. What is important is ideas.

author: Mary Kay Ash
quote: A mediocre idea that generates enthusiasm will go further than a great idea that inspires no one.

author: Friedrich Nietzche
quote: We often refuse to accept an idea merely because the tone of voice in which it has been expressed is unsympathetic to us.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: I know quite certainly that I myself have no special talent. Curiosity, obsession and dogged endurance, combined with self-criticism, have brought me to my ideas.

author: Antoine St. Exupery
quote: A pile of rocks ceases to be a rock when somebody contemplates it with the idea of a cathedral in mind.

author: Charles Kettering
quote: If you want to kill any idea in the world, get a committee working on it.

author: Woody Allen
quote: Right now it's only a notion, but I think I can get the money to make it into a concept, and later turn it into an idea.

author: Jerry Garcia
quote: Just because you're a musician doesn't mean all your ideas are about music. So every once in a while I get an idea about plumbing, I get an idea about city government, and they come the way they come.

author: Pablo Picasso
quote: I begin with an idea and then it becomes something else.

author: Arthur C. Clarke
quote: New ideas pass through three periods: 1) It can't be done; 2) It probably can be done, but it's not worth doing; 3) I knew it was a good idea all along!

author: Alfred North Whitehead
quote: Almost all really new ideas have a certain aspect of foolishness when they are just produced.

author: Paula Poundstone
quote: Adults are always asking little kids what they want to be when they grow up because they're looking for ideas.

author: Warren Buffet
quote: You do things when the opportunities come along. I've had periods in my life when I've had a bundle of ideas come along, and I've had long dry spells. If I get an idea next week, I'll do something. If not, I won't do a damn thing.

author: Alfred Nobel
quote: If I have a thousand ideas and only one turns out to be good, I am satisfied.

author: Swami Vivekananda
quote: Take up one idea. Make that one idea your life. Think of it, dream of it, live on that idea. Let the brain, muscles, nerves, every part of your body, be full of that idea, and just leave every other idea alone. This is the way to success. That is way great spiritual giants are produced.

author: William J. Cameron
quote: Money never starts an idea; it is the idea that starts the money.

author: Winston Churchill
quote: No idea is so outlandish that it should not be considered.

author: Thomas Mann
quote: If you are possessed by an idea, you find it expressed everywhere, you even smell it.

author: Bernard Baruch
quote: The ability to express an idea is well nigh as important as the idea itself.

author: Medgar Evers
quote: You can kill a man, but you can't kill an idea.

author: Rosabeth Moss Kanter
quote: After years of telling corporate citizens to 'trust the system', many companies must relearn instead to trust their people and encourage them to use neglected creative capacities in order to tap the most potent economic stimulus of all: idea power.

author: Mark Twain
quote: The man with a new idea is a crank - until the idea succeeds.

author: Steve Jobs
quote: To turn really interesting ideas and fledgling technologies into a company that can continue to innovate for years, requires a lot of discipline.

author: Frank Lloyd Wright
quote: An idea is salvation by imagination.

author: John Cage
quote: I can't understand why people are frightened of new ideas. I'm frightened of the old ones.

author: Thomas Watson
quote: The great accomplishments of man have resulted from the transmission of ideas of enthusiasm.

author: Tom Peters
quote: The new idea either finds a champion or it dies. No ordinary involvement with a new idea provides the energy required to cope with the indifference and resistance that change provokes.

author: Sam Walton
quote: Our best ideas come from clerks and stockboys.

author: Goethe
quote: Daring ideas are like chessmen moved forward: they may be beaten, but they may start a winning game.

author: Martin Fowler
quote: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.

author: John Johnson
quote: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.

author: Coco Chanel
quote: In order to be irreplaceable, one must always be different.

author: Chris Heilmann
quote: Java is to JavaScript what car is to Carpet.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: Knowledge is power.

author: Dan Salomon
quote: Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday, rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday’s code.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote: Perfection is achieved not when there is nothing more to add, but rather when there is nothing more to take away.

author: Cory House
quote: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it’s bad.

author: Steve Maguire
quote: Fix the cause, not the symptom.

author: Kent Beck
quote: Optimism is an occupational hazard of programming: feedback is the treatment.

author: Martin Fowler
quote: When to use iterative development? You should use iterative development only on projects that you want to succeed.

author: Austin Freeman
quote: Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.

author: Ralph Johnson
quote: Before software can be reusable it first has to be usable.

author: Kent Beck
quote: Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
